document_data.name: Egg Platter
document_data.mainbody: The '''egg platter''' was one of the specialty dishes of the [[Dryad's Dreams]], the only festhall in [[Mosstone]], [[Tethyr]].
document_data.Description: The egg platter was a collection of various hard-boiled [[bird]] [[egg]]s, such as [[quail]], [[swiftwing]], [[grouse]], and [[goose]]. The eggs were shelled and served on a bed of mouth-burning hot [[spices]] and dips, ready to be rolled and eaten. The spices used for the dish were notorious for their heat, and it was recommended to have [[wine]] or [[beer]] handy to release the feeling of flames in one's mouth.
document_data.History: The egg platter was served at the Dryad's Dreams in the mid-to-late-14{{th}} century [[DR]]. The dish was praised by [[Volothamp Geddarm]] in one of his published travel guides.
